intro: Tapeinosperma gracile, commonly known as the slender African milkwood, is a small to medium-sized tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and small, opposite leaves. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along riverbanks. The species is valued for its hard, durable wood and has traditional uses in local communities.
